thread.title: Rebels WR Laquon Treadwell joins Biletnikoff watch list
thread.title_full: Rebels WR Laquon Treadwell joins Biletnikoff watch list

title: Rebels WR Laquon Treadwell joins Biletnikoff watch list
text:
Rebels WR Laquon Treadwell joins Biletnikoff watch list Daniel Paulling, The Clarion-Ledger 8:38 a.m. CDT October 14, 2015 Ole Miss wide receiver Laquon Treadwell has been added to the Biletnikoff award watch list. (Photo: Justin Ford, Justin Ford-USA TODAY Sports) 1 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
OXFORD — Ole Miss wide receiver Laquon Treadwell joined six other players in being added to the Biletnikoff award watch list on Wednesday morning. 
The Rebels junior has caught 35 passes for 510 yards — he’s tied for No. 24 nationally in both — and three touchdowns this season. His average of 85 receiving yards per game ranks No. 34. 
Treadwell entered this season with 120 receptions for 1,240 yards and 10 touchdowns, despite missing the Rebels’ final four games last season due to a gruesome left leg injury. 
He made three preseason All-America first teams and four second teams and 10 preseason All-SEC first teams, as well as the Maxwell award and Walter Camp player of the year watch lists. 
He’s tied for fifth in program history with 13 touchdown catches, is ranked fourth with 155 career receptions and has caught a pass in 28 consecutive games he’s played in. 
Treadwell has been projected by ESPN football analyst Mel Kiper Jr. as a first-round selection in next year’s NFL Draft if he chooses to leave college early. 
Demarcus Ayers (Houston, junior), Shelton Gibson (West Virginia, sophomore), Richie James (Middle Tennessee State, redshirt freshman), Kenny Lawler (California, junior), Gabe Marks (Washington State, junior) and Jordan Williams (Ball State, senior) were also added Wednesday. 
The Biletnikoff is given each year to the top wide receiver in college football.
